name: symfocus
description: AI-powered symbol explanations in the sidebar, backed by any OpenAI-compatible endpoint.

symfocus.openai.baseUrl.description: Base URL for an OpenAI-compatible API, without /chat/completions (e.g. https://api.openai.com/v1, or your proxy, LiteLLM, Ollama, etc.). Required.

symfocus.openai.apiKey.description: API key (token) for the OpenAI-compatible endpoint. Required. Never shared or logged.

symfocus.openai.model.description: Model name for chat completions (e.g. gpt-4o-mini, gpt-4o, claude-3-5-sonnet via proxy, llama3, etc.). Required.

symfocus.context.includeDetail.description: Include LSP detail (e.g. function signature) in the prompt.

symfocus.context.includeDefinition.description: Call executeDefinitionProvider and add "Defined in path:line" when in another file or different range.

symfocus.context.includeReferences.description: Call executeReferenceProvider and add a "Used in …" line. Can be slower in large workspaces.

symfocus.context.referencesCap.description: Max reference locations to include when includeReferences is true.

enumDescriptions: Summary only (1-2 sentences) — fast, no fluff
Summary + relevant sections based on symbol type
Full analysis with all applicable sections
symfocus.explanation.mode.description: How detailed the explanation should be.

enumDescriptions: More verbose explanations with basic concepts explained
Concise explanations assuming familiarity with the language
symfocus.explanation.experienceLevel.description: Your experience level — affects verbosity and whether basic concepts are explained.

symfocus.explanation.projectContext.description: Describe your project domain (e.g., 'robotics control system', 'financial trading platform', 'React web app'). Leave empty for auto-detection from README/package.json.

scripts.compile: npm run build:css && npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js
scripts.package: npm run build:css && npm run check-types && npm run lint && node esbuild.js --production
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
